Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleWrite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleOp<BleWrite>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleWrite
  • public final class BleWrite
extends BleOp<BleWrite>
    Builder-type class for sending a write over BLE. Use this class to set the service and/or characteristic UUIDs, and the data you'd like to write. This class provides convenience methods for sending booleans, ints, shorts, longs, and Strings. Use with BleDevice.write(BleWrite), or BleDevice.write(BleWrite, ReadWriteListener). Note that all BleOp classes assume the device you're talking to is ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN. While Java is ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN by default, android actually is ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN, so the convenience methods take this into account by reversing the bytes. If you don't want this to happen, the call setIsBigEndian(boolean) to false.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BleWrite.Builder
      Builder class to build out a list (or array) of BleWrite instances.

      • BleWrite

        public BleWrite​(BleWrite write)
        Constructor which creates a new BleWrite from an existing one. This only copies over the service, characteristic, the writeType, and if it's bigEndian or not. This does NOT copy over any listeners, filters, or data.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public final boolean isValid()
        Description copied from class: BleOp
        Returns true if the minimum values have been set for this operation
        Specified by:
        isValid in class BleOp<BleWrite>

      • setIsBigEndian

        public final BleWrite setIsBigEndian​(boolean isBigEndian)
        Tells SweetBlue the endianness of the BLE device you want to perform a write to. This value only matters if you are using any of the convenience methods:

        setBoolean(boolean)
        setInt(int)
        setLong(long)
        setShort(short)
        setString(String)
        setString(String, String)

      • setWriteType

        public final BleWrite setWriteType​(ReadWriteListener.Type writeType)
        Set the ReadWriteListener.Type of the write to perform. This is here in the case that the characteristic you are writing to has more than one write type associated with it eg. BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_NO_RESPONSE, BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_SIGNED along with standard writes.

      • getWriteType

        public final ReadWriteListener.Type getWriteType()

      • getWriteType_safe

        public final ReadWriteListener.Type getWriteType_safe()
        This is almost the same as getWriteType(), only that this will never return null. If the writetype wasn't explicitly set, it will be null, in this case, this method will return the type as ReadWriteListener.Type.WRITE.

      • setBytes

        public final BleWrite setBytes​(byte[] data)
        Set the raw bytes to write.

      • setBoolean

        public final BleWrite setBoolean​(boolean value)
        Set the boolean to write.

      • setInt

        public final BleWrite setInt​(int val)

      • setShort

        public final BleWrite setShort​(short val)
        Set a short to be written.

      • setLong

        public final BleWrite setLong​(long val)
        Set a long to be written.

      • setString

        public final BleWrite setString​(String value,
                                String stringEncoding)
        Set a string to be written. This method also allows you to specify the string encoding. If the encoding fails, then String.getBytes() is used instead, which uses "UTF-8" by default.

      • setString

        public final BleWrite setString​(String value)
        Set a string to be written. This defaults to "UTF-8" encoding.
